contextId.information: There are words left out in this statement that can be added. AT: "as someone who has authority taught and not as the scribes taught" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: as someone who has authority and not as the scribes

contextId.information: There are words missing from this statement that may be added to make it more clear. AT: "mankind was not made for the Sabbath" or "God did not make mankind for the Sabbath" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to repeat "is it lawful," as that is the question Jesus is asking again in another way. AT: "is it lawful to save a life or to kill" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: to save a life, or to kill

contextId.information: The word "many" refers to the large number of people Jesus had already healed. AT: "Because Jesus had healed many people, everyone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: For he healed many, so that

contextId.information: The amount of grain produced by each plant is being compared to the single seed from which it grew. AT: "Some plants bore thirty times as much as the seed that the man had planted" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: some brought forth thirty times as much

contextId.information: Jesus continues to describe the amount of grain that was produced. Ellipsis is used here to shorten the phrases but they can be written out. AT: "and some produced sixty times as much grain and some produced a hundred times as much grain" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: and some sixty, and some a hundred

contextId.information: This refers to the grain that the plants produce. AT: "some produce thirty grains, some sixty grains, and some a hundred grains" or "some produce 30 times the grain that was sown, some 60 times the grain that was sown, and some 100 times the grain that was sown." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] or [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
contextId.quote: â€”thirty, sixty, or a hundred times what was sown

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state that the boat was filling up with water. AT: "the boat was in danger of being filled with water" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the boat was almost full of water

contextId.information: It can be stated clearly that the men gave their report to the people who were in the city and countryside. AT: "to people in the city and in the countryside" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: in the city and in the countryside

contextId.information: It may be helpful to state why the people were amazed. AT: "all the people who heard what the man said were amazed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add information to this phrase. AT: "the other side of the sea" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The phrase "the whole truth" refers to how she had touched him and became well. AT: "told him the whole truth about how she had touched him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The word "They" refers to the twelve and does not include Jesus. Also, it may be helpful to state that they went out to various towns. AT: "They went out to various towns" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to state that they cast the demons out of people. AT: "They cast many demons out of people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add some missing information. AT: "I will give you up to half of what I own and rule, if you ask for it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This refers to the Sea of Galilee. This can be stated clearly. AT: "to the other side of the Sea of Galilee" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The phrase "the loaves" refers to when Jesus had multiplied the loaves of bread. This can be stated more clearly. AT: "what it meant when he had multiplied the loaves of bread" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "that is, they ate with unwashed hands" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "the remaining broken pieces of bread and fish, which filled seven large baskets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the remaining broken pieces, seven large baskets

contextId.information: The word "others" refers to other people. Also, it may be helpful to add missing information. AT: "Other people say you are ... other people say you are" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"becomes stiff." It may be helpful to state that it is his body that becomes rigid. AT: "his body becomes rigid" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "came out of the boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"cast the unclean spirit out." It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "cast the unclean spirit out of the boy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
They respond this way, meaning that they are able to drink the same cup and endure the same baptism. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The missing words may be added. AT: "to be served by people, but to serve people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: to be served, but to serve

contextId.information: It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "We do not know where the baptism of John came from" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "They said, 'They are Caesar's likeness and inscription'" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The missing information may be added. AT: "who are raised from being dead" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
The missing information may be added. AT: "the most important commandment of all ... The most important commandment says" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: the most important of all ... The most important is

contextId.information: Missing information can be added. AT: "kingdom will rise against kingdom" or "kingdom will fight against kingdom" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

This means that a father will betray his child, and this betrayal will cause the child to be killed. AT: "a father will deliver up his child to death" or "a father will betray his child, handing him over to be killed" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
This refers to returning to his house. This can be made explicit. AT: "not return to his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to specify which "days" are referred to. AT: "had shortened the days of suffering" or "had shortened the time of suffering" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The missing word may be added. AT: "so as to deceive people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

The missing information may be added. AT: "if possible, they will even deceive the elect" or "they will even try to deceive the people whom God has chosen" (UDB) See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
It may be helpful to add the missing information. AT: "We must not do it during the feast" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

"I will not" can be fully expressed as "I will not fall away." The phrase "not fall away" is a double negative and carries a positive meaning. This can be expressed in the positive if needed. AT: "Even if everyone else leaves you, I will stay with you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublenegatives]])
contextId.quote: Even if all fall away, I will not

contextId.information: Jesus is asking God to do what he wants to be done and not what Jesus wants. AT: "But do not do what I want, do what you want" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
contextId.quote: But not my will, but yours

contextId.information: The missing word may be added. AT: "will build another temple" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This phrase can be completed. AT: "You yourself have said that I am" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
The missing information may be added. AT: "released instead of Jesus" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
